story: Steven Clift shared a post to the group: g0v.tw 後勤中心.
description:
What do you know about online tools that support participatory budgeting?

In particular, I am interested in online tools used by the public to vote, rank, or allocate a budget toward specific projects.

I am interested in how funders support PB models with significant online components like Better Reykjavik.

On a related note, what is the highest voter turn-out a PB project has claimed to date?
name: Steven

data.message: Any results from this event? Is PB being used in some cities in Taiwan?

Some interesting code from Iceland - islands unite! 
https://github.com/rbjarnason/your-priorities-app - Powers Your Priorities ideation tool used in dozens of countries

https://github.com/rbjarnason/open-active-voting - The participatory budgeting engine used by the City of Reykjavik and soon in Scotland.
